caption:
This image portrays an elderly man lying on a sofa. He is partially covered with a gray blanket, his head rests on a white pillow at one end of the sofa, and he holds a red bandana in one hand. The man wears a red and white striped shirt, and looks directly at the camera with a serene and thoughtful expression.

The background is rustic and simplistic, featuring wooden paneling that lines the wall behind the sofa. The lighting in the room is soft and natural, suggesting that the photo might have been taken during the daytime. The mood appears quiet and contemplative. There's a small doily placed on the back of the sofa, adding a touch of homeliness to the scene. This photograph captures a moment of rest or repose, possibly in a personal living space or a family home environment.
title: Ken Hatfield, 74, of Newton, West Virginia, near Charleston, in Mingo County. A World War II veteran, he began working in the mines at 18 and was employed underground at least 30 years. A sick man, he has lost one leg. He receives $78 a month in Social Security payments, plus a veterans pension of $148 per month. Hatfield said he was having a tough time. Paul Bryant is a neighbor and looks in on him.
